lines.text:
[Nick holds an M-16 on the bad guys]
Have you handled a machine gun before?
Sure, lots of times, in high school. I was the captain of the machine gun team.
May I ask, why d'ya keep a shotgun in your apartment?
It's not really mine. An old boyfriend left it here.
Why did he keep it?
I don't really know. You don't ask a guy named Icepick too many questions.
I like to breathe, I'm good at it.
What's your problem, aside from your face?
Yes, one monent please but an important one. we been through stretch, stretch-aroo, next it'll be stretch-mark... where will it end?

[affecting a snobbish accent]
Will someone please settle this? In a Rolls Royce Corniche, the bar opens from left to right, not right to left, doesn't it?
I'd give you the finger but I'm too refined.
I'm surprised all women haven't tried to kill you!
How you doin' Lyle? How's that pretty Mrs. of yours?
Oh, fine.
He's married to a former Miss Universe.
Really?
Yeah, I don't just move ashtrays.

[In bed, Hillary removes her panties and hands them to Nick]
Another man has been holding these panties. You know I can tell.
It's, it's my father.
What?
He did my laundry for me, I swear.
Your father's a professional hockey player who scored two goals that night... and an assist?
Oh, God. I should have burned those panties.
But why, Hillary? Why would you wanna sleep with...
I was lonely! You were gone! I went out with a bunch of girls. I had a bunch of drinks. We met a bunch of guys.
You had a bunch of sex!

[Nick is being tested by two researchers, a man and a woman]
Someone's had sex on this table.
[they share guilty looks]
All right Miss Pickle.
That's PickELL, Dr. Whiney.
Whine-er
Sorry.
I have something for you.
I have something for you.
Here. It's an aphrodisiac. It's made from the horn of rhinoceros and dried rabbit glands.
[hands a pill to Nick]
But no sugar, I hope. Ooh! Are there rhinoceroses in a garage in New Jersey?
What?
A garage in New Jersey. I swear that's where this was made.

Y'know what's happening here? You two are feelin' a lot of sexual tension as a result of the near miss in Nick's tent last night. Why don't you guys work that out? I'll turn around, give you a couple minutes. Have a good time.

[Immediately]
Harry, you can turn around now.
Already? I'd see a doctor about that.

[as they set off to find Harry, Jr., Nick holds the shirt Harry gave him]
This isn't your son's shirt.
Sure it is.
No. This shirt's only been worn by one man, an older man much too old to be your son.
Did I say my son? No! I'm sorry. I'm *his* son. It's my father that's missin', Harry, Sr.
He's not that old, he's about your age.
I'm adopted. My mother remarried. One of my high school buddies. She saw his picture in my yearbook and, WHAMMO.
You're very brave.
Everybody looks brave holding a machinegun.
I brought my own food. I'm taking no chances. This is all dehydrated.
So are you.

[Sylvia and Nick are kissing]
You know, I'm curious. When did you decide you liked me?
Oh... I guess when you tried to save my life. I... I appreciated that. I thought back then, He's really nice. I thought, If there was ever anything I could do for him, I will.
What do you mean?
What do you mean?
Do for me? What, like now?
What's happening here? A minute ago you were ready to disappear down my throat.
I don't know. This is, uh, starting to sound a little like... charity.
I must have said the wrong words. I admit, I'm not that smart. I'm not a museum person.
Well, you know, the way it's coming out, you're looking for a little action, there's nobody here but me and Harry, and I won. But not by much.
Ok...
[adopts a sarcastic tone]
I want you bad, alright? I dream about you and me and a house in Long Island. I'm only half a woman 'til I make love to you.
[reverts to normal voice]
Are you happy now?
Must we spoil what's been a depraved and embarassing evening?
[Sylvia gasps]
No no no, please, not another word. This is just the way I want to forget you.
Screw you!
No thanks!
Boy, Nick, you really know how to show a girl a good time.

[enters the tent, hair set with pins and in a hairnet]
Hey, I forgot to ask you. Can I sleep on this?
Who gives a shit?
[leaves the tent]
What's the matter with her?
I wouldn't sleep with her!
Really?
[grins]
Sylllviaaaa!
a women, she's dead
dead? a woman? where?
she's easy to find she's the one that's dea... that's odd
the police must have hauled her off
no no no, it's only been 5 minutes and we'd have hear the police. there'd be one of thos chalk outlines of the body
maybe she bounced, like outta the hotel. women are soft
a gang! a gang took her away so that no questions could be asked
so we're discounting the bouncing theory?
completely. a gang that's gonna take another shot at me.
Louise says gang
well gangs are not necessarily bad. ya know there are nice gangs, there was our gang, alfalfa, buckwheat...
To whom were you speaking?
To youm.
